rules.natural: If a legal challenge is pending against Company X, then it is not the case that Company X produced the documentary.
Provided that the environmental impact assessment is approved, then either the documentary features rare species or the documentary features a protected habitat.
Under the condition that the scene includes heavy rain, the scene includes flooding.
Given that the scene includes flooding, the scene includes river overflow.
If the scene includes erosion, then the scene includes a landslide.
Assuming the editor selects clip A, then if the scene includes river overflow, the scene includes erosion.
Either the editor selects clip A or the editor selects clip B.
Given that the editor selects clip B, then whenever the scene includes river overflow, the scene includes erosion.
Either a public apology is issued by Company X, or if an ethical violation is alleged against Company X, then Company X did not produce the documentary.
Provided that narration is recorded by a voice actor, then it is not the case that a public apology is issued by Company X.
If narration is recorded by the director, then a public apology is not issued by Company X.
Assuming the sound mixer prefers the voice actor, then either narration is recorded by a voice actor or narration is recorded by the director.
The sound mixer prefers the voice actor or the sound mixer prefers the director.
Provided that the sound mixer prefers the director, then narration is recorded by a voice actor or narration is recorded by the director.
If a drone is used for an aerial shot, then the crew enters the national park.
Whenever there is a copyright issue with archive footage, a license is obtained for archive footage.
Given that there is a copyright issue with archive footage, it is not the case that a license is obtained for archive footage.
If the documentary features rare species, then if the government agency funded the project, Company X did not produce the documentary.
Under the condition that an original soundtrack is composed, filming is not delayed by weeks.
An original soundtrack is composed or a licensed soundtrack is composed.
Provided that a licensed soundtrack is composed, music is licensed from a popular artist.
Whenever music is licensed from a popular artist, filming is not delayed by weeks.
Assuming the documentary features a protected habitat, then if the government agency funded the project, Company X did not produce the documentary.
Either a filming permit is granted for the national park or a filming permit is denied for the national park.
If a filming permit is denied for the national park, then the documentary features a protected habitat.
Whenever the crew enters the national park, the documentary features rare species.
Provided that footage of rare species is captured, the crew enters the national park.
If the director approves the shooting plan, then if a filming permit is granted for the national park, footage of rare species is captured.

If it is not the case that either an alternative permit is secured or if a filming permit is granted for the national park then the documentary features rare species, then filming is delayed by weeks.
If it is not the case that if a filming permit is granted for the national park then a drone is used for an aerial shot, then a helicopter is used for an aerial shot.
Provided that it is not the case that if a filming permit is granted for the national park then the crew enters the national park, then there is a copyright issue with archive footage.
If it is not the case that a legal challenge is pending against Company X, then a settlement is reached between Company X and the agency.
If it is not the case that the environmental impact assessment is approved, then the scene includes heavy rain.
Provided that the documentary does not receive a greenlight, then Company X produced the documentary.
